definition: to express in words or writing/to make a speech (esp. short introduction, vote of thanks, afterword, funeral homily etc)/to address (an audience)/same as 致詞|致词
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: One of the girls she rescued from a pimp later graduated from high school as valedictorian.
sentences.chinese: 其中一个她所救的女孩之后在高中毕业典礼上致辞。

sentences.english: Then, a official from the Zhuhai Bureau of Education made a speech first.
sentences.chinese: 接下来，会议开始了，珠海教育局副局长首先致辞。

sentences.english: UN Under-Secretary-General for Disarmament Affairs Nobuyasu Abe attended and addressed the opening ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 联合国副秘书长阿部信泰出席开幕式并致辞。

sentences.english: Speech by Mr. Jim Cheng, Secretary of Commerce and Trade of State of Virginia.
sentences.chinese: 维吉尼亚州商务贸易厅厅长郑叔霆致辞祝贺。

sentences.english: Now, we welcome Mr. Zhang Xiaolin, Executive Vice Mayor of Hefei to deliver his remarks.
sentences.chinese: 下面首先请合肥市常务副市长张晓麟先生致辞。

sentences.english: “Enjoy the stalking, ” was his farewell remark.
sentences.chinese: “享受盯梢追捕的乐趣”，他临别致辞。

sentences.english: Provincial CPPCC Vice-Chairman attended the awards ceremony and delivered a speech Lee Tak-keung.
sentences.chinese: 省政协副主席李德强出席表彰大会并致辞。

sentences.english: Speech by Mr. Mike Jing, Virginia State Governor's Advisor on Asian Affair.
sentences.chinese: 维吉尼亚州州长代表景明先生致辞祝贺。

sentences.english: Li Changchun, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee will attend and address the opening ceremony of the Forum.
sentences.chinese: 中共中央政治局常委李长春将出席论坛开幕式并致辞。

sentences.english: Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Zhukov also addressed the opening ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯副总理茹科夫出席论坛开幕式并致辞。

sentences.english: The following photo shows Zhu Ling, editor-in-chief of China Daily, delivering a speech.
sentences.chinese: 下图为中国日报社总编辑朱灵致辞。

sentences.english: At the celebration ceremony, Jiang Weixin delivered a speech on behalf of the Asian countries.
sentences.chinese: 在庆典仪式上，姜伟新代表亚洲国家致辞。

sentences.english: Firstly, let's invite Mr. Tang Zhenghong to have an address.
sentences.chinese: 首先，有请教育局副局长汤正洪先生致辞。

sentences.english: Mayor Wang Hongju delivered impassioned address on the reception.
sentences.chinese: 市长王鸿举在招待会上发表了热情洋溢的致辞。

sentences.english: State Councilor Tang Jiaxuan attended and addressed the seminar.
sentences.chinese: 国务委员唐家璇出席会议并致辞。

sentences.english: Other services such as giving a speech in praise of a bride or the groom cost extra.
sentences.chinese: 若要提供其它服务如致辞赞美新郎或新娘需额外收费。

definition: to make a speech/to make some remarks
